Articles.Content:
I'm just spitballing here, but I was thinking about how I'd love to be the guy to go around fixing everyone's cockpits to be RPM compatible but I have neither the expertise nor time for it. But a thought popped in my head that VisualViewer has the Toolbar option of having a pop out window that shows what you'd see if it were on an RPM MFD.

Would it be hard to add something similar to RPM? Have a window you can toggle on that floats over the display with a MFD for when you don't have an RPM ready cockpit? Or maybe even to use it outside of IVA? It's not nearly as immersive as the real thing but it's a much preferred stop-gap than nothing.
Is there a way to have RPM count Snacks as a Life Support Mod for those fancy Life Support Displays?

> 
> 
> On 9/30/2018 at 6:28 AM, cy-one said:
> 
> 
> Is there a way to have RPM count Snacks as a Life Support Mod for those fancy Life Support Displays?
> 

The life support display is part of the ASET props pack.  It looks like alexustas uses a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch to reconfigure the prop for one of two or three LS mods already (take a look at GameData/ASET/ASET\_Props/Misc/LifeSupportMonitor), so I imagine that all it would take is someone doing the same thing for Snacks.

> 
> 
> On 9/30/2018 at 6:28 AM, cy-one said:
> 
> 
> Is there a way to have RPM count Snacks as a Life Support Mod for those fancy Life Support Displays?
> 

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, MOARdV said:
> 
> 
> The life support display is part of the ASET props pack.  It looks like alexustas uses a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch to reconfigure the prop for one of two or three LS mods already (take a look at GameData/ASET/ASET\_Props/Misc/LifeSupportMonitor), so I imagine that all it would take is someone doing the same thing for Snacks.
> 

I have a config for that in the next version of Warbird Cockpits, I can probably post it. It's a little hacky since I am no good at modeling, but it works.

One moar?EDITED,of course=)

I've given RasterPropMonitor v0.30.5 a very cursory test (maybe 5 minutes in the ALCOR lander), and it appears to be working in KSP v1.5.0 without a recompiled.  I have not tested it extensively, I have not tested it against existing mods (most of which haven't had time to update), and I haven't checked to see which stock IVAs are now broken (Mk1 pod, perhaps?).

With some trepidation, I also add: As of today, RasterPropMonitor is up for adoption. I have not committed any updates to RPM since last June, and I have no interest in working on new features for RPM when I'm working on a very similar (but more capable) mod that I hope to finalize for release this fall.

Plus, I'd like to spend some time playing the game instead of only modding it.

If someone wants to pick up the RasterPropMonitor mod, I am happy to help figure out what's what and where's where until you're able to manage it on your own.  Otherwise, go ask your IVA creators (very nicely) to start migrating to MOARdV's Avionics Systems. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Hello everyone, I downloaded airplane plus and they have little multi-function displays in the IVA's. They do not work with RPM.  I want to replace them with the RPM ones. How would I even begin to do that. I know very little about modding.

This mod is amaizing to say the least but it really does need to be updated to include IVA's for the newest capsules, and some old ones too (like the inline mk2 cockpit) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I have a question. RPM is on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>. But MAS isnt. I read on your wiki that MAS is backwards compatible with RPM. If I am to install RPM through <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>(as its still a dependency for some mods), would I just need 'RPM core'?? What does the the RPM(not core) contain? I assume it contains IVA prop stuff? Would your MAS mod have everything the RPM(not core) contains?

Hope my question makes sense?

Thanks!

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, Jesusthebird said:
> 
> 
> I have a question. RPM is on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>. But MAS isnt. I read on your wiki that MAS is backwards compatible with RPM. If I am to install RPM through <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>(as its still a dependency for some mods), would I just need 'RPM core'?? What does the the RPM(not core) contain? I assume it contains IVA prop stuff? Would your MAS mod have everything the RPM(not core) contains?
> 

MAS isn't backwards compatible, actually.  It's meant as a replacement, and it will be able to do anything RPM can do, but it will require someone to convert IVAs from RPM to MAS (or create new IVAs).  As for <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>, I have no involvement in the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> stuff, so I really don't know why RPM is split into multiple components.  That's something you might need to ask on the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> thread, or maybe someone else here knows the answer.

Despite my previous plans, I have released one final version.  **RasterPropMonitor v0.30.6** is available on [GitHub](https://github.com/Mihara/RasterPropMonitor/releases).  This is purely a maintenance release - some KSP function signatures were marked obsolete, so RPM v0.30.6 uses the updated versions of those functions, which should extend its shelf life.  I have not tested RPM extensively, since I don't expect to spend any more time working on it.

But space planes command pod work correctly. I have tri to reinstall RPM and Module Manager without success.

Thanks !

P-S: I'm french, I'm sorry for my english
